definitions.definition: To tend steadily upward or downward.
definitions.example: The road slopes sharply down at that point.

definitions.definition: To form with a slope; to give an oblique or slanting direction to; to incline or slant.
definitions.example: to slope the ground in a garden;   to slope a piece of cloth in cutting a garment

definitions.definition: (usually followed by a preposition) To try to move surreptitiously.
definitions.example: I sloped in through the back door, hoping my boss wouldn't see me.

definitions.definition: To hold a rifle at a slope with forearm perpendicular to the body in front holding the butt, the rifle resting on the shoulder.
definitions.example: The order was given to "slope arms".

definitions.definition: An arrangement or motion by which something slopes.
